724310f-a.title: Manhattan: Waverly Place - Washington Square West
724310f-a.text:
108-112 Waverly Place, south side, east of Washington Square West.
May 5, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724310f-a.folder: Waverly Place & Washington Square West, Manhattan, NY

721172f-a.title: Manhattan: MacDougal Street - Washington Square North
721172f-a.text:
Macdougal Street, east side, the last block, from Washington Sduare
North (Waverly Place) to 8th Street. One of Greenwich Village's
outdoor art exhibitions is going on; paintings and drawings are
hhung on the fence along the side of The Richmond Hill. the seven-
story apartment house (about 1895) at 28-27 Washington Scuare North.
Opposite the head of Macdougal Street may be seen Nos. 29, 31, 33
West 8th Street.
MAy 1, 1933.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
721172f-a.folder: MacDougal Street & Washington Square North, Manhattan, NY

724013f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Square North - MacDougal Street
724013f-a.text:
(1)
Washington Square North, east from Macdougal Street (Washington
Square West). The building on the N.E. corner is the Richmond
Hill, an apartment house built about 1900 on the site of two
old houses. In the backgrouhd rises the new apartment build-
ing at 1 University Place.
Novemben 19, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same view, a little over two years later, and from a 1ittle
nearer to Washington Square, so that part of the One Fifth
Avenue apartment house shows over the roof of 26 Washington
SGuare North, adjoining the Richmond Hill.
Washington Sduare North is geograpnically a part of Waverly Place
(q.v.), but was set apart and given its own house numbers early
in the 1850's.
February 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724013f-a.folder: Washington Square North & MacDougal Street, Manhattan, NY

724025f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Square West - Waverly Place
724025f-a.text:
Washington Square Park: The band stand in the western portion of
the Park. Buildings in the background line the western side of Washing-
ton Square West, from Washington Place (left) to Waverly Place (right,
not seen).
December 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724025f-a.folder: Washington Square West & Waverly Place, Manhattan, NY

724025f-b.text:
Washington Square Park: The band stand in the western portion of

724011f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Square North - MacDougal Street
724011f-a.text:
28-17 Washington Square North, from Macsougal Street towards Fifth
Avenue, seen across the N.W. corner of the Square. 27-8, the
Richmond Hill, on the corner of Macsougal Street, was built
around 1900 on the site of two old private houses.
In the backgrouns may be seen the Metropolitan tower, at Masison
Avenue aws 24th Street, ane behind it the needle spire of the
Chrysler Builaiag at LeAington Avenue sas 42nd Street.
August, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724011f-a.folder: Washington Square North & MacDougal Street, Manhattan, NY
